description: Strand units: Spatial awareness, 2-D shapes, 3-D shapes, Symmetry and Angles

teaching.topicContent: Introduce the pentagonal prism as a 3-D shape with two pentagonal bases and rectangular sides. Explore and compare the number of faces, edges, and vertices of the pentagonal prism. Discuss real-world examples of pentagonal prisms and their applications.

Introduce the hexagonal prism as a 3-D shape with two hexagonal bases and rectangular sides.  Investigate the properties of hexagonal prisms, including the number of faces, edges, and vertices. Engage in hands-on activities to explore and construct hexagonal prisms.
Introduce the triangular pyramid as a 3-D   Investigate the properties of triangular pyramids, including the number of faces, edges, and vertices.  Compare triangular pyramids with other 3-D shapes.
Introduce the cone as a 3-D shape with a circular base and a curved surface.Explore the properties of cones, including the number of faces, edges, and vertices.

Introduce the cylinder as a 3-D shape with two parallel circular bases and a curved surface. Investigate the properties of cylinders, including the  Engage in activities that involve measuring and comparing cylinders.

Discuss the concept of nets as 2-D patterns that can be folded to create 3-D shapes.Engage in activities that involve drawing nets for various 3-D shapes. Use nets to construct the corresponding 3-D shapes.

teaching.topicTitle: Lesson: Exploring and Measuring Angles in 3-D Shapes
teaching.topicContent: Extend the concept of angles to 3-D shapes.Identify and measure angles formed by the intersection of faces in 3-D shapes. Explore how angles in 3-D shapes relate to their properties.

teaching.topicTitle: Lesson: Applying Angles to 3-D Shape Design
teaching.topicContent: Discuss how angles play a role in the design and construction of 3-D objects.Engage in design activities that involve incorporating specific angles into 3-D shapes. Explore the relationship between angles, symmetry, and aesthetics.

teaching.topicTitle: Lesson: Exploring Angles in Rotation with 3-D Objects
teaching.topicContent: Extend the concept of angles in rotation to 3-D objects. Investigate angles formed by rotating 3-D objects around different axes. Engage in hands-on activities that involve rotating 3-D objects and measuring resulting angles.

Introduce the concept of symmetry in 3-D shapes. Identify planes of symmetry in various 3-D shapes, including prisms and pyramids.Engage in hands-on activities to create 3-D shapes with specific planes of symmetry. Discuss the importance of symmetry in design, art, and architecture.

teaching.topicTitle: Lesson: Building 3-D Shapes Using Geometric Solids
teaching.topicContent: Introduce geometric solids as basic building blocks for constructing more complex 3-D shapes.      Explore how combinations of cubes, spheres, and other solids can be used to create various shapes.Engage in a collaborative project where students work together to build a larger 3-D structure using geometric solids.Reflect on the creativity and problem-solving skills required for building intricate 3-D shapes..
